docs.title: Yuzu Inventory System
docs.text: A powerful inventory model able to be used with built in or any other UIs Uses event based architecture

docs.title: Features
docs.text:
• Stacking items
  • Drag and drop items
  • Separation of UI, Model, Controller
  • UI Prefabs can be used with custom assets
  • Multiple Inventory UIs/ Hotbars
  • Able to add custom logic to use item
  • Lots of exposed C# events to hook into
  • Able to resize inventory at runtime
  • Item System using Scriptable Objects

docs.title: Instructions to Add Package to Unity Project
docs.text:
• In Unity, go to Windows->Package Manager
  • Click the '+' button on the top left
  • Select "Add Package from Git URL"
  • Copy and Paste in https://github.com/yuzhengwen/inventory-system-unity.git
  • Click "Add"
  • Choose Files to Import
  • Done!

docs.title: Backend
docs.text: Add 'Inventory' MonoBehaviour to Game Object. This has the benefit of being able to inspect inventory slots in the editor in runtime. To use, simply get a reference to the inventory object.

docs.title: UI
docs.text: After that, call the AssignInventory() method to assign an inventory backend to display.

docs.title: Adding a Controller
docs.text:
The InventoryController Class:

using InventorySystem;
using System;
using UnityEngine;

[RequireComponent(typeof(Inventory))]
public class InventoryController : MonoBehaviour
{
    private Inventory inventory;
    [SerializeField] private UI_Inventory uiInventory;

    public event Action<ItemDataSO> OnItemCollected;
    private void Start()
    {
        inventory = GetComponent<Inventory>();
        uiInventory.AssignInventory(inventory);

    }
    public void AddCollectibleToInventory(ItemDataSO data)
    {
        inventory.AddItem(data, 1);
        OnItemCollected?.Invoke(data);
    }
}
